metadata.title: Daily Pointers
metadata.description: Brief pointers to recognition, 1-3 sentences each, for daily contemplation

pointers.text: Notice that you are aware right now. This simple fact of awareness is what you truly are.
You are not your thoughts. You are what is aware of thinking.
Peace is not found in experience. It is the background of all experience.
Before the next thought arises, what are you?
Happiness is not caused by getting what you want. It is revealed when seeking ceases.
The separate self is not an entity. It is an activity of thinking and feeling that comes and goes.
Awareness is always present. Notice it is here now, even as you read these words.
You share your being with everyone and everything. This recognition is love.
The peace you long for is the peace you are.
Can you find a time when you are not aware? Awareness is eternal, timeless.
Feelings come and go in awareness. Awareness remains untouched.
You are the happiness you seek.
There is no distance between you and what you are. Recognition is immediate.
The body appears in awareness. You are not limited to the body.
Thoughts cannot know awareness. Awareness knows thoughts.
Right now, before any doing, what are you?
The world appears in your awareness, not you in the world.
Peace is uncaused. It does not depend on circumstances.
You have never left home. You are already what you are seeking.
Notice the space between thoughts. This aware space is what you are.
Sensations come and go. What is aware of sensations?
The separate self cannot be found upon investigation. Look for it now.
Love is the recognition that we share our being with all things.
You cannot step out of awareness. It is what you are.
The seeker is the sought. What is looking is what you are looking for.
Perceptions appear in awareness like images on a screen. The screen is never disturbed.
When thinking stops, are you still here? Yes. That is what you are.
Happiness is the nature of awareness, your true nature.
There is no need to change experience. Simply notice what is aware of it.
The sense of 'I' that thinks and chooses is temporary. The 'I am' that witnesses is eternal.
You are not in the present moment. The present moment appears in you.
Peace is not the absence of activity. It is the presence of awareness.
Behind all seeking is the peace you already are.
The pathless path: recognize what you already are.
Awareness has no qualities, yet all experience appears in it.
What remains when everything else is removed? Only awareness.
You cannot become awareness. You can only recognize that you are awareness.
The separate self is a fiction, a habit of thought, not what you are.
In deep sleep there is peace. Not because experience has ended, but because seeking has ended.
Am I aware? This simple question returns you home.
The content of experience changes constantly. The awareness of experience is unchanging.
You are the knowing presence in which all experience appears.
Resistance creates suffering. Awareness welcomes all experience as itself.
There is nowhere to go, nothing to achieve. Simply be what you are.
The peace in deep sleep is the peace of your being, always present.
Thoughts cannot disturb awareness, just as waves cannot disturb the ocean.
Who is aware of this thought? Find the 'I' that is aware.
The body is known. What is it that knows the body?
Happiness is not found in objects. It is the nature of the subject, awareness itself.
Every experience is embraced in awareness, never rejected.
The progressive path takes time. The direct path is immediate recognition.
You don't need to purify awareness. It is inherently pure, untouched by experience.
The question 'Who am I?' dissolves the questioner, leaving only awareness.
Let experience be as it is. You are the allowing space of awareness.
The world is made of the same knowing awareness that you are.
Peace and happiness are not states to attain. They are the nature of what you are.
When you know yourself as awareness, the search for happiness ends.
The separate self appears in awareness. Awareness is never separate.
Right now, notice: Are you aware? That which says 'yes' is what you are.
Nothing needs to be different for you to be awareness. You already are.
The past and future appear as thoughts now. Only awareness is timeless.
Every sensation, thought, and feeling borrows its existence from awareness.
You are not the doer. You are the aware presence in which doing appears.
The desire for peace is the call of your true nature, which is already peaceful.
Awareness is self-aware. It knows itself without needing thought.
The mind says 'I think.' Awareness says 'I am.'
What you are cannot be lost. It can only be temporarily overlooked.
Everything you experience is intimately close, appearing in your own awareness.
Meditation is not something awareness does. It is the recognition of awareness itself.
The belief 'I am the body' appears in awareness. Investigate this belief.
Before knowledge, before experience, what is present? Only awareness.
Love is the dissolution of the sense of separation.
The separate self is the belief that awareness is limited to a body-mind.
Peace is not disturbed by activity. It is the background of all activity.
You are that which is looking, not what is seen.
Happiness is what remains when the agitation of seeking subsides.
The direct path: turn attention away from objects toward the subject, awareness.
Every experience is an expression of infinite awareness.
The mind cannot grasp awareness. Awareness is prior to mind.
Right now, what is aware of these words? That is what you are.
You are the common factor in all experience.
Suffering is resistance to what is. Peace is allowing what is.
The sense of being a separate person is a contraction in awareness, not what you are.
Awareness is empty of content yet full of knowing.
There is no 'your awareness' and 'my awareness.' There is only awareness.
The world is not made of matter appearing to awareness. It is made of awareness appearing as matter.
Peace is the fragrance of being, always present.
Every belief appears in awareness. Awareness believes nothing.
When you stop trying to be something, you discover what you are.
The body-mind is an appearance in awareness, like a character in a dream.
Rest as awareness. Let all experience come and go.
The search for enlightenment is the activity that obscures what you already are.
No experience can give you awareness. You are already awareness.
The feeling of 'I' is the presence of awareness mixed with thought.
Everything you perceive is a modulation of awareness, like waves in the ocean.
There is nothing to practice to be awareness. Simply notice what you already are.
Love is the natural condition when the separate self is seen through.
Awareness is the light that illuminates all experience.
You are not aware sometimes. You are awareness always.
The progressive path promises future freedom. The direct path recognizes present freedom.
Peace is not found in stillness versus activity. It is found in recognizing what you are.
The separate self lives in time. Awareness is timeless.
What is it that hears these words? Find that, and you find yourself.
Awareness is intimate with all experience yet never becomes experience.
The happiness of being needs no reason, no cause, no object.
All spiritual practices are either a preparation for or a celebration of this recognition.
The separate self is the first and primary resistance in awareness.
Awareness is not passive. It is the active knowing presence behind all experience.
When the separate self relaxes, peace is revealed.
You don't have awareness. You are awareness.
The desire to understand awareness is the mind's last attempt to possess what it cannot grasp.
Every experience is the play of awareness with itself.
Liberation is not freedom from experience. It is freedom as awareness.
The direct path does not lead to awareness. It reveals what you already are.
In the absence of seeking, happiness shines by itself.
The witness is not separate from awareness. It is awareness recognizing itself.
Nothing is outside awareness. Everything is an expression of it.
The separate self is not your enemy. It is a misunderstanding to be seen through.
Awareness is both completely empty and completely full.
You are already home. Just notice.
